name: Week1: Vera Molnar 1
description: A recreation of Vera Molnár's square art using Garrit Schaap's code example. Each cell has layered rectangles with random positions and bright, semi-transparent colors on a black background. I aimed for a vibrant, glowing effect.

name: Week1: Vera Molnar 2
description: This variation uses triangles instead of squares, inspired by Vera Molnár's square art, using Garrit Schaap's code example. Each cell has layered triangles with randomized positions and pastel colors on a black background. I aimed for a gentle, dreamy effect.

name: Week1: Vera Molnar 3
description: This variation replaces the layered triangles with layered circles, increases the wobble variance, and uses a gradient alpha for a softer, more playful effect.

name: Week1: Perlin's noise 1
description: A landscape art created using Perlin noise inspired by Garrit Schaap's noise example and The Coding Train. It features two layered mountains with subtle transparency to create depth, set against a soft blue sky. The mountains drift gently, giving a calm, dreamy motion.

name: Week1: Perlin's noise 2
description: A night variation of my earlier landscape. I experimented with darker colors, increased hill height, and slightly changed the noise settings and I also added a moon to complete the scene.

name: Week 2&3: Perlin's noise Snowfall 1
description: This variation builds on my earlier Perlin noise landscapes and adds a particle system inspired by the Coding Train's smoke effect code to create snowfall. The flakes drift softly down the canvas with fading transparency, giving a calm and peaceful first-snow winter mood.

name: Week 2&3: Perlin's noise Snowstorm 2
description: This is a variation of my snowfall piece where I modified the particle system to create a stormy effect. The snowflakes move faster, drift sideways, and vanish quicker, giving the feeling of a windy snowstorm, and the darker background adds to the mood.

name: Week 2&3: Flow field glow 1
description: With help from Barney Codes, I experimented with a flow field. Each line overlaps and blends, making the colors feel alive and change randomly on click.

name: Week 2&3: Flow field ink 2
description: This variation draws pure black lines that twist and overlap in a chaotic way until the canvas is filled. I removed the interaction so the flow happens automatically. I added random stroke weights for a hand-drawn energy, and made the particles flow in opposite directions instead of just one.

name: Week 2&3: Flow field retro 3
description: This variation uses circles instead of the lines, in this retro-inspired flow field. I experimented with speed, colors, and frame count to create a chaotic but hypnotic movement.

name: Week 2&3: Flow field De Stijl 4
description: This variation is a De Stijl inspired, using square shapes and a bold color palette. I experimented with both the flow and color change speeds to make it very wavy and dynamic.

name: Week 4: Bouncy ball Tone.js
description: I made a playful Tone.js piece with a ball bouncing around the canvas. It changes color and plays a note every time it hits an edge, creating a fun interaction with sound and motion.
